documentation.title: API Documentation
documentation.subtitle: Comprehensive guide for integrating with the PICO SulTeng COVID-19 API

overview.title: API Documentation
overview.subtitle: Comprehensive guide for integrating with the PICO SulTeng COVID-19 API. Get real-time Indonesian COVID-19 data with our RESTful endpoints.
overview.gettingStartedSub: Quick start guide to using the PICO SulTeng API
overview.noAuthRequired: No authentication required for public endpoints

nationalLatest.title: Get Latest National Data
nationalLatest.description: Retrieve the most recent national COVID-19 statistics for Indonesia.

nationalHistorical.title: Get Historical National Data
nationalHistorical.description: Retrieve comprehensive historical COVID-19 data for Indonesia with flexible date filtering and sorting options. This endpoint is ideal for trend analysis, data visualization, and research purposes, allowing you to access daily statistics from the beginning of the pandemic.
nationalHistorical.usageNote: Use this endpoint when you need time-series data, want to analyze trends over specific periods, or require historical context for current statistics. For real-time or latest data only, use the /national/latest endpoint instead.

rootEndpoint.title: Get All Available Endpoints
rootEndpoint.description: Retrieve a list of all available API endpoints with descriptions and usage examples.
rootEndpoint.responseDescription: Returns JSON object containing all available endpoints with their descriptions

healthCheck.title: Health Check
healthCheck.description: Check API health status and database connectivity. Essential for monitoring API availability.
healthCheck.status503: 503: API is degraded or experiencing issues

provinces.title: Get All Provinces
provinces.description: Retrieve all Indonesian provinces with their latest COVID-19 case data.
provinces.excludeLatestCase: exclude_latest_case (boolean) - Optional: exclude latest case data from response

provinceCases.title: Get Province Cases
provinceCases.description: Retrieve COVID-19 cases for specific provinces with hybrid pagination and flexible filtering options.
parameters: limit (integer) - Records per page for pagination
offset (integer) - Number of records to skip
all (boolean) - Return all data without pagination
start_date (string) - Filter data from this date (YYYY-MM-DD)
end_date (string) - Filter data until this date (YYYY-MM-DD)

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.subtitle: API access and security information
authentication.noAuthDescription: All PICO SulTeng API endpoints are publicly accessible and do not require authentication keys or tokens.

errorHandling.title: Error Handling
errorHandling.subtitle: HTTP status codes and error responses

glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.subtitle: Key terms and concepts used in the PICO SulTeng COVID-19 API

reproductionRate.title: Reproduction Rate (Rt)
reproductionRate.definitionText: The effective reproduction number representing the average number of secondary infections caused by one infected individual at time t.
reproductionRate.growing: Epidemic is growing (each case infects >1 person)
reproductionRate.dataAvailabilityText: Values may be null during the first 7 days or when there's insufficient data for reliable calculation.
reproductionRate.formulaDescription: The reproduction number Rt is estimated using Bayesian inference with the following key components:

practicalExample.title: Practical Example
practicalExample.subtitle: Central Sulawesi COVID-19 Cases (7-day period)
practicalExample.calculationTitle: Step-by-step calculation for R_t on Jan 7:

step3.title: 3. Calculate 95% credible intervals:
step3.explanation: Using posterior Gamma distribution: R_t | data ~ Gamma(43, 25.6)

gammaQuantileFormula.title: Gamma Quantile Formula:
gammaQuantileFormula.formula: Q(p; α, β) = F⁻¹(p; α, β) where F is the Gamma CDF
gammaQuantileFormula.description: For Gamma distribution with shape α=43 and rate β=25.6:

step3.mathematicalNote: Note: In practice, statistical software uses more precise numerical methods (Newton-Raphson, Brent's method) for inverse Gamma calculations.

result.title: Final Result:
result.interpretation: R_t = 1.68 (95% CI: 1.25-2.18) → Epidemic is growing with high confidence

note.title: Note:
note.content: Serial interval weights (w_s) are based on gamma distribution with mean=5.0 days, std=3.0 days

recovered.title: Recovered Cases
recovered.description: Patients who have recovered from COVID-19

daily.title: Daily Data
daily.description: New cases reported for a specific day

cumulative.title: Cumulative Data
cumulative.description: Total cases accumulated since the start of tracking

percentages.title: Percentages
percentages.description: Distribution of cases as percentage of total positive cases

serialInterval.title: Serial Interval
serialInterval.description: Time between symptom onset in successive cases in a chain of transmission

indonesianTerminology.title: Indonesian COVID-19 Terminology
indonesianTerminology.subtitle: Official Ministry of Health (Kemenkes) terminology for COVID-19 case classification
indonesianTerminology.officialNote: Official basis for COVID-19 data reporting as of 2021

kasusSuspect.name: Kasus Suspect
kasusSuspect.description: Person from an area with local transmission within 14 days before illness, or had contact with confirmed/probable case, or severe respiratory infection requiring hospitalization with no specific identified cause.

kasusProbable.name: Kasus Probable
kasusProbable.description: Clinical COVID-19 case with severe symptoms, ARDS or severe respiratory distress, not yet laboratory tested via RT-PCR.

kontakErat.name: Kontak Erat
kontakErat.description: Person who contacted a confirmed or probable case within the infectious period.

kasusKonfirmasi.name: Kasus Konfirmasi
kasusKonfirmasi.description: Positive RT-PCR test result with two subcategories: symptomatic and asymptomatic cases.

otg.description: Legacy term: Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 but show no symptoms. Now classified under confirmed cases (asymptomatic).

odp.description: Legacy term: Individuals monitored for 14 days after exposure. Now classified as Suspect Cases.

pdp.description: Legacy term: Patients with symptoms requiring medical supervision. Now classified as Probable Cases.

classificationProgression.title: Official Classification System
classificationProgression.description: Kemenkes updated terminology in 2021 for more precise epidemiological classification and reporting mechanisms
classificationProgression.officialQuote: This calculation basis will be used starting today for COVID-19 data reporting

footer.description: Comprehensive COVID-19 data API for Central Sulawesi, providing real-time statistics and historical data.
